instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message:
Hi guys,

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was LD near left hinge (as seen normally) and it is missing  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> but line has a diode mode of 0.330

The issue seems identical to this thread: [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-20v-0-03-amps.61049/[/URL]

Other voltages look good and board is very clean.

Any ideas? Haven't tried DFU mode yet..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message:
Not similar problem, as you don't have short on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> rail.

"Other voltages look good"
Do you mean all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages present?
If yes, try to access it in DFU mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message: I flashed it in DFU choosing restore and it came back to life but internet recovery gives error 2003 and the laptop apparently is locked for USB booting.. any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message:
Try some of the tips Google search brings up
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?q=macbook+internet+recovery+error+2003&client=firefox-b-d&hl=es&source=lnms&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjNtoH7vJLzAhUkRvEDHW-6DEQQ_AUIcCgA&biw=1408&bih=615&dpr=1.36[/URL]
Start with this:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://softwaretested.com/mac/how-to-resolve-error-code-2003f-on-mac/[/URL]
on bottom page.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message: ok thanks! Il check it out although I think its trolling me as I tried again earlier and got error 2002f... is this different? apologies for the bombardment of questions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message: ok I managed to install big sur by connecting to a different WiFi and I had to issue Terminal commands to start the installation from USB as the recovery procedure hanged. All good now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LD -> 20v / 0.045a
threads.message:
Thanks for solution feedback.
I'm pretty sure this can help other members in the future.
